intro: Eruca viminea, commonly known as slender garden cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and narrow, pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in moist, fertile soils and is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in disturbed areas. Eruca viminea is an annual herb that produces small, edible seeds, which are sometimes used in culinary applications.
